resources.string: The use or alteration of cells or biochemicals to provide a useful product describes:
How can we ensure that all of the bacteria growing on medium contain the introduced recombinant DNA?
A) Incubate the bacteria at a high temperature.
B) Incubate the bacteria for a long period of time.
C) Incubate the bacteria for a short period of time.
D) Incubate the bacteria with the same antibiotic for which the recombinant DNA expresses a resistance gene.
The process of copying a gene\'s DNA sequence into a sequence of RNA is called
A) adenine, thymine, guanine, cytosine, uracil.
A) Genetic engineering manipulates gene products at the level of the DNA.
B) A knockout mouse is so named because it contains aggression genes.
C) The first drug produced using recombinant DNA technology was penicillin.
D) The first organism to have its genome sequenced was Haemophilus influenzae.
Different genes evolve at different rates. True or false?
